title: Dear Supports...
body: Don't complain about my 'negative behaviour' when I get a trinket before you get a Sightstone, with you stealing my CS and being an AFK bot in lane.

replies.body: Dear adc, be negative and I'll just leave you and go somewhere else. -- all supports

I'm not sure why so many people have down-voted this.
I am a support main, and I think I'm a relatively good one, at least in comparison to most other supports I see. 

I always try to peel for my adc and keep them alive as much as I can, get them fed if I can, keep a pink in tri-bush, ward in front of dragon, bush closest to enemy, and one somewhere else depending on the situation. 

So any support mains should know very well you get plenty of supports like this out and about. I've even seen other "support mains" that are down right terrible at their job. Go way too ham, never ward, etc. 

When I've been forced into adc, I, even at this point in time and where I play at, I have had supports that _didn't know_ relic shield only came with 2 stacks, so they would try to take every minion and didn't understand why I told them to stop. 
Or the supports who "roam to help" but leave you to get ass-blasted 2v1 bot because they leave at a bad time and take way too long to come back. etc.



On support defenses, I hate bad adc's so much. Like completely incompetent. I try to keep my cool, but sometimes if I'm playing a more ap-carry oriented support and you don't even know how to last hit minions, I'm definitely taking the ones you weren't going to get because it's useful gold for me and otherwise wasted since you can't farm.
The adc's that just sit there and never ever trade or pay attention to anything going on around them. Don't leash kruggs, doesn't come when support initiates a trade, doesn't come to help get dragon, etc. 

do you know how hard it is trying to spoon feed people who are even too bad to be spoon fed? and god forbid they ward a bush when you're out of wards because all hell breaks loose. 



just my 2 cents.
